text: Hi everyone, I am working on a custom coded email that pulls values from a custom object. The web version of this email does not display values pulled from the custom object.  Has anyone figured out a way to achieve this. If so, can you please guide me. TIA!

Hi Srishida! At this time, it's not possible for the web version of an email to display custom object tokens. This is mentioned <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/create-a-web-version-of-your-marketing-email|in this help article.> So sorry for that!

Hi guys! I am trying to send an email to an active list and want to include a deal property as a personnalised token in it without having an automated email (I need a regular one, as this is a one-time email, and I do not want to redesign my whole deal pipeline just to send this email). Do you know if there is a way to do this?

Hi there! It's not possible to use deal tokens in emails that are not set for automation. The reason for this is because one contact can have many deals, and the workflow is what tells the email which deal to pull the information from.
Okok that's unfortunate, but thank you for your answer

<@U034KMMDRS7> you could consider using the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/create-programmable-emails|programmable email beta> and the `crm_objects` function to pull in a deal. This would require use of design manager and HubL so a somewhat technical approach
Thank you for the correction, Joe!

Hello! I am trying to figure out if there is a way to better design an Email Subscription Preference Page in HubSpot without having to code it? It doesn't seem like there is a lot of flexibility there. Our client is really just looking to make it more visually appealing with fixes like background colors, font sizes, alignment, etc. Does anyone have a workaround for this or is it strictly something that needs to be coded?
There are a few ways to do this - I think I worked on something that created a separate branding file and passed these values into the main template.
